revised_title: Anatomy and Development of Cysticercus cellulosae in Pig Muscles
tldr: The author examines the structure and development of Cysticercus cellulosae, a parasitic cyst found in pig muscles. The cysts are primarily located in striped muscles and contain a white, opaque body and a transparent sac. The author also describes the anatomy of the cyst, including its ventral portion and neck, which contains hooklets and suckers for attachment.
